title: Dark Star Thresh
body: I used my own money that i saved up to buy rp, i purchase the thresh skin then in game it does not show up, in champ select it says locked, please HELP{{champion:412}} {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body: that feels like kind of a huge fuck you to people that already bought the skin, i mean it's like we pre ordered it and aren't getting any sort of ward like idk a mystery skin or something
It was disabled just minutes ago due to a game-impacting bug. Your purchase went through properly, just wait for him to be re-enabled.

Oh thank god, i was pretty scared not gonna lie.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Sorry about this! There was a bug that was severely impacting gameplay - particularly those for the enemy team, which is why the skin was disabled. You still own the content, it's just not able to be equipped in game at the moment. We've had a group of Rioters who have been working throughout the weekend to resolve the bug, and we're in the process of verifying a fix for the issue.
Is there going to be any form of compensation for those who haven't been able to use their newly-bought skin for like 4 days now?
To my knowledge, there aren't plans to do so.

I must say that it feels really shitty not to be able to use the skin I bought for (at least) half a week, and constantly get reminded about it everytime I open league (the login screen).

This was the only skin I had been really excited about for a long time: I loved the theme, and Thresh being one of my favourite champions, it was pretty much the perfect skin for me.

It would be at least nice to have the service status say something like "We apologise for the inconvenience".
Is there a way you guys can give an ETA on its finish?
Unfortunately not - as Tidal Tyrant mentioned, we don't want to make promises we can't keep.

Fingers crossed; hoping to see a hotfix when I get home later today.

https://i.imgur.com/1HvNiEO.png?noredirect

If she, or one of her collegues were to gives us an ETA, people would get upset if it ends up being later..
Unfortunatly, that's how the internet forces people to act
